68% #carbonemissions cuts (on 1990 levels) by 2030 is both low ambition and deceptive maths

The UK has already cut emissions by 45% on 1990 levels, so 68% = only a 42% reduction on 2020 emissions

The UK must show #RealLeadership by targeting at least a 75% #NDC for #COP26
"Sclerotic traffic, long commutes, and pollution all increase." #environmentalimpacts #carbonemissions https://t.co/xuoBNpwDjm

Key point: the UK has already reduced its #carbonemissions by 45% on 1990 levels, largely through decarbonising electricity generation‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ 75% (on 1990 levels) = only 54.5% reduction on 2020 emissions, over the 10 years to 2030.

#RealLeadership  from @Ed_Matthew1 in the run up to Glasgow hosting #COP26 next December‚Ä¶

Ed makes the compelling case why the UK needs to target a 75% #NDC reduction in #carbonemissions (on 1990 levels) to claim any international leadership.

‚ö°Ô∏è ‚ÄúIndia‚Äôs CO2 Emissions Dropped by 15.4% in First Half of 2020; Study Shows 8.8% Drop Globally. The bigger question - is it time to rejoice just yet?‚Äù - by @deekshith_np 

#emissions #carbonemissions #CO2Emission 
https://t.co/cOksJCYXyI
The Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research analysed real-time data to understand the impact of an unprecedented #lockdown on global #carbonemissions https://t.co/ToJQEOEZeP

On the other hand, the largest emitter in the world, #China, witnessed a relatively small decrease in the CO2 emissions by 187.2 Mt, which amounted to a mere 3.7% drop compared to 2019.

#CarbonEmissions

The US witnessed a drop of 338.3 Mt (13.3% less than 2019) of CO2, followed by the European Union (EU27) and the UK at 205.7 Mt (12.7% less than 2019). 

#CarbonEmissions

No reason to celebrate

In terms of absolute volume, the study observed the most pronounced decline in carbon emissions from the United States in the first half of 2020. 

#CarbonEmissions

In India, the greatest decrease in CO2 emissions was recorded in April (44.2%), followed by May (27.6%), March (16.9%) and June (15%). 

#CarbonEmissions

This is the sharpest fall of year-on-year emissions among all the major economies in the world‚Äîin line with the drastic fall of 23.9% in Gross Domestic Products witnessed in the first quarter of FY 2020-21.

#CarbonEmissions

Consequently, as per the study, India has witnessed a whopping 15.4% drop in carbon emissions in the first six months of 2020‚Äîequivalent to 205.2 Mt lesser emissions compared to the same period in 2019. 

#CarbonEmissions

India went through one of the most restrictive lockdowns during the early days spread from March to May.

#CarbonEmissions

This accounts for a sharp drop of 8.8%‚Äîmore than the drop witnessed during the economic recessions or World War II.

#CarbonEmissions

A new study from the researchers from China and France show that the global carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions have dropped by more than 1,500 Million Tonnes (Mt) cumulatively in the first half of 2020 compared to the same period last year. 

#CarbonEmissions

Here‚Äôs something a bit positive for your Thursday afternoon! A new study by an international research team have estimated an 8.8.% global reduction in carbon emissions within the first half od 2020! #ClimateAction #CarbonEmissions
